meanings.definition: To complain or find fault constantly
meanings.sent1: She carped about the weather all day.
meanings.sent2: He always carped about his noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The cat carped at the lack of treats in its bowl.
meanings.sent4: The student carped at the unfairness of the test.
meanings.sent5: The old man carped at the slow service in the restaurant.

meanings.definition: To seize or take advantage of something eagerly
meanings.sent1: The opportunity presented itself, and she carped it immediately.
meanings.sent2: He carped the chance to showcase his talent.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel carped the nut before the other animals could get to it.
meanings.sent4: She carped the last piece of cake before anyone else could grab it.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur carped the market trend and launched a successful business.

meanings.sent1: She carped her disappointment at not being invited to the party.
meanings.sent2: He carped his frustration with the slow progress of the project.
meanings.sent3: The child carped about having to eat vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The customer carped about the poor quality of the product.
meanings.sent5: The employee carped about the lack of recognition for their hard work.
